Both movies seem like they could resonate well with your preferences!

If you're in the mood for something unique, "Safety Not Guaranteed" might pique your interest. This film follows three magazine employees on an assignment to interview a man seeking a companion for time travel, offering a mix of comedy and mystery.

It seems you're drawn towards time travel stories! If you enjoy the unique blend of politics and personal struggles, I'd recommend "We the Living". This film presents a vivid portrayal of life during the Russian Revolution, showcasing Ayn Rand's insightful exploration of individuality versus the collective.

Alternatively, if you're looking for a more contemporary time travel story, you might also enjoy "Alex in Wonderland", which features encounters with iconic film personalities like Jeanne Moreau and Paul Mazursky as it explores the life of a movie director grappling with artistic freedom and commercial success.

conversation.text: It sounds like you're really into time travel films! Two movies that might intrigue you are "12 Monkeys" and "Groundhog Day". In "12 Monkeys", a convict is sent back in time to gather information about a deadly virus, starring notable actors like Bruce Willis and Brad Pitt. On the other hand, "Groundhog Day" follows a weatherman who finds himself reliving the same day over and over again, featuring Bill Murray in a memorable performance. Both movies offer unique takes on time travel and are highly recommended!
